name: Fungi
description: Fungal diseases affect the leaves, stems, or roots of plants and often appear as mold, mildew, or rust.
treatment: Use appropriate fungicide. Remove infected parts and avoid overwatering.

name: Leotiomycetes
description: A class of fungi known to cause blight and decay in plant tissue.
treatment: Prune infected areas and apply antifungal treatments during early signs.

name: Rust
description: Rust appears as orange, yellow, or brown pustules on leaves and can spread rapidly.
treatment: Remove affected leaves. Use sulfur-based fungicides.

name: Powdery Mildew
description: A fungal disease that appears as white powdery spots on leaves.
treatment: Increase air circulation, avoid overhead watering, and apply fungicides.

name: Leaf Spot
description: Leaf spot diseases cause dark or light spots on leaves, often leading to leaf drop.
treatment: Remove affected leaves and apply fungicides if necessary.

name: Blight
description: Blight causes rapid browning and death of plant tissues, especially in leaves and stems.
treatment: Remove infected parts and apply appropriate fungicides.

name: abiotic
description: Downy mildew appears as yellow or white patches on the upper surface of leaves, with a downy growth underneath.
treatment: Improve air circulation, avoid overhead watering, and apply appropriate fungicides.
